ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Re: Installing problems osx matlab
ygData.msgSnippet: The warnings resulting from the -arch i386 flag are not a problem. By default, python tries to build a universal binary. This warning just means that your

The warnings resulting from the -arch i386 flag are not a problem. By  
def=
ault, python tries to build a universal binary. This warning just  
means t=
hat your compiled code will run on ppc architectures, but not  
i386 ones.
=

The file setup.m is generated and then later removed in the build  
proces=
s. Actually all it does is change to the 'cantera' directory  
and then inv=
oke 'buildux.m' to build the Cantera toolbox. If Matlab  
can't find the se=
tup.m file, check that the current directory is on  
the Matlab search path=
.

One thing to be aware of on the mac: Matlab R2006b for the PowerPC  
arc=
hitecture is compiled with g++ 3.3, and so all of Cantera must be  
compile=
d with this version of g++ too to use it in Matlab.  On the  
other hand, P=
ython is compiled with g++ 4.x, and Cantera must be  
built with this compi=
ler version to use it in Python. What this means  
is that if you want to u=
se Cantera in both Python and Matlab, you  
need to build two separate vers=
ions.

On the Intel i386 platform, Matlab R2006b is compiled with g++ 4.x, =
 
and this problem doesn't arise.

Dave
